intro: Phyllanthus acutissimus, commonly known as the sharpleaf phyllanthus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered yellow flowers. The plant has lance-shaped leaves with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and traditional medicine.
